labels.analysis: The MCP Server described is a Flight Search Service primarily focused on enabling users to search for flights (one-way and round-trip) with real-time data integration via SerpAPI. It emphasizes ease of use, logging for tracking purposes, and a modular structure for scalability. The available tool ("Optional Settings") suggests user authentication and basic server management. The core functionality revolves around travel-related searches and data retrieval.
labels.reasoning: The primary label is "Travel & Maps" as the core functionality is centered around flight search and trip planning, which aligns with travel services. The secondary label "Web Search & Research" is included because the service relies on an API to fetch real-time flight data, which is a form of web-based research. A custom label is not necessary as the predefined categories cover the server's key features.

server_info_crawled.name: Flight Search Service
server_info_crawled.author: @arjunprabhulal/mcp-flight-search
server_info_crawled.overview: Enable seamless flight searches with integrated MCP tools. Find one-way and round-trip flights effortlessly using our service that connects to SerpAPI for real-time data. Experience rich logging and a modular code structure for easy maintenance and scalability.

tools.name: Optional Settings
tools.description: Access and manage servers by signing in.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@arjunprabhulal/mcp-flight-search/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())

smithery_configuration_requirements.name: serp_api_key
smithery_configuration_requirements.description: SerpAPI key for Google Flights searches
